alert.note: Alert for Northern Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 18 at 2:46PM PST until December 20 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING FOR AREAS ABOVE 2000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 8 to 12 inches of snow expected tonight, with 2 to 6 inches on Sunday, and another 8 to 10 inches of snow Sunday night into Monday. Snow levels will lower tonight, then hold at 1500 to 2000 feet later tonight into Sunday, then rise to 2500 feet late Sunday into Monday. * WHERE...Northern Oregon Cascades. * WHEN...Until noon PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will be decreasing Sunday morning, but occasional light snow will continue through the day. Snow will increase again late Sunday night.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions visit https://www.tripcheck.com or https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map or by calling 5 1 1
